title: Legislative Day 39 (Pt. 2)- 2023 Session - 3/27/23
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia Legislative Day 39 (Pt. 2) - 2023 Session - 3/27/23 session:

## Overview
The session focused on passing several bills, including measures related to absentee ballot applications, time off for early voting, additional judges for the Superior Courts, and restrictions on the use of certain social media platforms on state equipment.

## Key Actions
**HR 256**: Not discussed
**SB 103**: Senate agreed to House substitute, adding more licensure requirements and a process for conflicting claims related to the Department of Revenue.
**SB 129**: Senate agreed to House substitute, revising language on absentee ballot applications and providing for time off for employees to advance vote.
**SB 66**: Senate agreed to House substitute, providing for an additional judge for the Superior Courts of the Atlantic Judicial Circuit.
**SB 211**: Not discussed

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced.

## Notable Moments
- Senator from the 8th presented SB 103, noting it was a request from the Department of Revenue.
- Senator from the 25th presented SB 129, describing it as a "good housekeeping bill" to provide time off for early voting.
- Senator from the 4th presented SB 66, explaining the House changed the start date for the new judge position.
- Senator from the 31st presented SB 93, referring to it as the "TikTok bill" to restrict use of certain social media platforms on state equipment.

## Votes
- SB 103 passed 43-4
- SB 129 passed 46-3
- SB 66 passed 53-0

## Attendance
The Senate excused the Senators from the 12th and 22nd.

## Adjournment
The session details do not include the time of adjournment or the date of the next session.
